nl.vu.ip
Class Message

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--nl.vu.ip.Message
public class Message
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a protocol message and implements the protocol's wire format. It is able to serialize and deserialize messages. The Message class is used by the static methods of the BankClient class.

Note that the protocol's wire format is documented in a separate file.

Author:
Erik van Zijst - erik@prutser.cx - 07.apr.2003

Method Detail

serialize

public java.lang.String serialize()
                           throws MarshalException
Takes the message properties and serializes them to a character string that can be send over a TCP stream.
The implementation is similar to that of the C programs.

Returns:
the serialized message string.
Throws:
MarshalException - thrown when the message properties could not be serialized.

deserialize

public void deserialize(java.lang.String buf)
                 throws MarshalException
Takes a serialized message string and deserializes it. When this method returns, the public message properties will reflect the values from the serialized string.
The implementation is similar to that of the C programs.

Parameters:
buf - the serialized message string.
Throws:
MarshalException - thrown when the serialized message could not be deserialized.
